page.title: 14Farms and farmers
page.content: The area is rural in parts having many old farms, which are mostly dairy. Four farmers were interviewed. Ramgreave Hall Farm is the oldest building dating from 1600 when it was used as a hunting lodge by James I. It has 100 beef cattle on 179 acres and has not been modernised or extended. A coin probably from the 18th century has been found by the farmer. Horns Farm has a dairy herd of 75 Fresians. The farmer and his two helpers use 3 tractors to run the farm. Old Thatch Farm was a dairy farm, but now all the land has been sold off and the farmhouse used privately. Hocking House Farm has 35 Fresians and 50 sheep on 40 acres. The farmer sells his milk on a milk round. He has either untreated or pasteurised milk. He uses two helpers, a tractor and mower.
